intro: Lesquerella kingii var. cobrensis, commonly known as the Cobren's lesquerella, is a rare and specialized plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and distinctive seed pods that contain a valuable oil-rich seed. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to harsh environments, including deep root systems and waxy leaf surfaces. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
